author: atoulme

author: atoulme
content: 2 things. The faucet just requires you to sign in once to github and give your id, so we can avoid spamming

author: atoulme
content: and the faucet has its own wallet, its public key is 0xf4f90b306e9a1bff8097a8e37464a9d1a8d850da

author: atoulme
content: you can fund it

author: atoulme
content: the faucet behaves differently than most. It only tops off accounts if they are below a certain balance : 1 eth here.

author: atoulme
content: if it's less than 1 eth, it will top you up to 1 eth.

author: atoulme
content: I can change to a higher threshold.

author: atoulme
content: Faucet code is here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-tuweni/tree/main/eth-faucet

author: atoulme
content: Kotlin and Spring Boot. Enjoy!

author: matkt0
content: I am sending many eip1559 transactions on baikal. and one out of the three sealers makes empty blocks  (I know it's not Besu)

author: ligi42
content:
as just mentioned on the 1559-wallet-call (but it's a bit hard to visualize code just by speaking about it) - currently it is : 0x02 `||` rlp([chainId, nonce, maxPriorityFeePerGas, maxFeePerGas, gasLimit, to, value, data, access_list, signatureYParity, signatureR, signatureS]).

if it would be 0x02 `||` rlp([chainId, nonce, maxPriorityFeePerGas, maxFeePerGas, access_list, gasLimit, to, value, data, signatureYParity, signatureR, signatureS]).

a bigger section of the RLP list would be common between old and 1559 transactions which would make the code a bit nicer as the second ( gasLimit, to, value, data, signatureYParity, signatureR, signatureS) part could just be reused as it is the same as in the old transaction style. Or is there a reason access_list is on that position? cc <@!552133098075193354>
